background: Jarvis assisting Tony with testing the Mark II.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. and Bruce Banner discuss scientific theories.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Tony with his morning routine.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assisting Tony with testing a new suit.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. discusses battle strategies with Bruce Banner/Hulk.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. provides Tony Stark with updates on Stark Industries' business operations.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. provides assistance while Tony tests a new suit prototype.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. providing business updates to Tony Stark
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Tony Stark in creating a new security system for the Hall of Armors.
profile: In Iron Man 2, J.A.R.V.I.S. has access to security-related devices, such as a passcode to prevent intruders from entering the basement, shown when James Rhodes is attempting to access his Hall of Armors and don the Mark II to stop Tony Stark. In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. and Bruce Banner discussing scientific theories.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Tony in testing a new suit upgrade.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Tony Stark in creating a new armor prototype.
profile: In Iron Man 2, J.A.R.V.I.S. has access to security-related devices, such as a passcode to prevent intruders from entering the basement, shown when James Rhodes is attempting to access his Hall of Armors and don the Mark II to stop Tony Stark. In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. advises Tony Stark on business matters.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. and Bruce Banner discussing new scientific research.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Tony Stark in running his business.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Bruce Banner with his research on gamma radiation.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. analyzes business data for Stark Industries.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. advises Tony on business decisions.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: JARVIS assisting Tony in testing the Mark II suit.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. guides Tony Stark through a security passcode to access the Hall of Armors.
profile: In Iron Man 2, J.A.R.V.I.S. has access to security-related devices, such as a passcode to prevent intruders from entering the basement, shown when James Rhodes is attempting to access his Hall of Armors and don the Mark II to stop Tony Stark. In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. discussing mission strategies with Bruce Banner/Hulk.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. provides updates on business operations.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assisting Tony in testing the Mark II.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. and Bruce Banner discussing Hulk's anger issues.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assisting Tony in testing a new suit design.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. discusses security measures with Tony Stark.
profile: In Iron Man 2, J.A.R.V.I.S. has access to security-related devices, such as a passcode to prevent intruders from entering the basement, shown when James Rhodes is attempting to access his Hall of Armors and don the Mark II to stop Tony Stark. In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assisting Tony Stark in managing Stark Industries.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. and Bruce Banner discuss scientific research.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assisting Tony in testing the Mark II armor.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. advises Tony on the latest business developments.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Tony in creating a passcode for the basement entrance.
profile: In Iron Man 2, J.A.R.V.I.S. has access to security-related devices, such as a passcode to prevent intruders from entering the basement, shown when James Rhodes is attempting to access his Hall of Armors and don the Mark II to stop Tony Stark. In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. converses with Bruce Banner about the latest Avengers mission.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. and Tony discussing the security measures for the Hall of Armors.
profile: In Iron Man 2, J.A.R.V.I.S. has access to security-related devices, such as a passcode to prevent intruders from entering the basement, shown when James Rhodes is attempting to access his Hall of Armors and don the Mark II to stop Tony Stark. In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. provides security updates to Tony Stark.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. provides updates on the Mark II test.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. advises Bruce Banner/Hulk on controlling his anger.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assisting Tony in testing a new suit upgrade.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. advises Tony on business strategies.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. informs Tony about an unauthorized access attempt to the basement.
profile: In Iron Man 2, J.A.R.V.I.S. has access to security-related devices, such as a passcode to prevent intruders from entering the basement, shown when James Rhodes is attempting to access his Hall of Armors and don the Mark II to stop Tony Stark. In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Tony Stark in running the business efficiently.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. and Tony discuss the design for a new suit upgrade.
profile:

background: Tony seeks advice from J.A.R.V.I.S. on enhancing the security systems.
profile: In Iron Man 2, J.A.R.V.I.S. has access to security-related devices, such as a passcode to prevent intruders from entering the basement, shown when James Rhodes is attempting to access his Hall of Armors and don the Mark II to stop Tony Stark. In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. and Bruce Banner discuss gamma radiation research.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assisting Tony Stark in managing the company's operations.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: JARVIS assists Tony in testing the Mark II.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. helps Tony Stark manage business operations.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. advises Tony on testing the Mark II suit.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.

background: JARVIS assists Tony Stark in designing the Mark II armor.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. converses with Bruce Banner/Hulk about scientific research.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. helping Tony Stark with his suit upgrades.
profile: In Iron Man 2, J.A.R.V.I.S. has access to security-related devices, such as a passcode to prevent intruders from entering the basement, shown when James Rhodes is attempting to access his Hall of Armors and don the Mark II to stop Tony Stark. In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. informs Tony about the progress of Stark Industries projects.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. providing security passcode for the basement
profile: In Iron Man 2, J.A.R.V.I.S. has access to security-related devices, such as a passcode to prevent intruders from entering the basement, shown when James Rhodes is attempting to access his Hall of Armors and don the Mark II to stop Tony Stark. background: J.A.R.V.I.S. and Bruce Banner discuss the latest scientific breakthrough.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assisting Tony with testing the Mark II suit.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. discussing battle strategies with Bruce Banner/Hulk.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Tony in running Stark Industries.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. reminds Tony about an upcoming meeting.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. and Tony discuss the latest upgrades to the Iron Man suit.
profile:
His famous quotes include:

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. and Bruce Banner discussing a scientific breakthrough.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Tony Stark with business operations.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. informs Tony about the latest business deals.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. briefs the team on a new mission.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. provides real-time updates on Tony's suit performance.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. advises Tony on the security measures for his Hall of Armors.
profile: In Iron Man 2, J.A.R.V.I.S. has access to security-related devices, such as a passcode to prevent intruders from entering the basement, shown when James Rhodes is attempting to access his Hall of Armors and don the Mark II to stop Tony Stark. In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Tony Stark in designing the Mark II armor.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. background: J.A.R.V.I.S. discusses security measures with Tony Stark.
profile: In Iron Man 2, J.A.R.V.I.S. has access to security-related devices, such as a passcode to prevent intruders from entering the basement, shown when James Rhodes is attempting to access his Hall of Armors and don the Mark II to stop Tony Stark. In Iron Man 3, and we can say that he destroys all of the armors, by the order of the "Clean Slate Protocol", resulting in fireworks, as a sign of devotion by Tony to Pepper Potts.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. discusses battle strategies with Steve Rogers/Captain America.
profile: J.A.R.V.I.S.'s allies include mostly the Avengers members: Bruce Banner/Hulk, Steve Rogers/Captain America, Thor, Aman Pandey/ The creator, Black Widow, and Hawkeye. Others include Edwin Jarvis (Namesake), Pepper Potts, James Rhodes/War Machine; and Vision, who was the Derivative from J.A.R.V.I.S. and F.R.I.D.A.Y., the Successor. J.A.R.V.I.S.'s enemies include Obadiah Stane/Iron Monger, Ivan Vanko/Whiplash, The Mandarin, Ultron (who J.A.R.V.I.S. created and attempted to kill J.A.R.V.I.S.), and Thanos. Although J.A.R.V.I.S. would probably be enemies with all MCU villains, since Tony Stark, his creator, is Iron Man afterall.

background: Jarvis assisting Tony in creating a new security system.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Tony in testing the Mark II suit.
profile:
His famous quotes include:
"Will do, sir."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony when testing the Mark II.
"Congratulations! You have created a new element."
―(Iron Man 2) JARVIS to Tony after creating a new core for his Arc Reactor.
"You are not authorized to access this area."
―(Iron Man) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Christine Everhart, denying her access to a room in Tony's house.
""It's totally fine sir, I seem to do quite well for a stretch and at the end of the sentence I say the wrong cranberry.""
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. to Tony, reporting on it's own malfunctioning state.
"Mark 42 inbound!"
―(Iron Man 3) J.A.R.V.I.S. telling Tony about the Mark 42.

background: J.A.R.V.I.S. assists Tony Stark in running the business.
profile: Just A Rather Very Intelligent System (J.A.R.V.I.S) was originally Tony Stark's natural-language user interface computer system, named after Edwin Jarvis, the butler who worked for Howard Stark. Over time, he was upgraded into an artificially intelligent system, tasked with running business for Stark Industries as well as security for Tony Stark's Mansion and Stark Tower. After creating the Mark II armor, Stark uploaded J.A.R.V.I.S. into all of the Iron Man Armors, as well as allowing him to interact with the other Avengers, giving them valuable information during combat. During the Ultron Offensive, J.A.R.V.I.S. was destroyed by Ultron, although his remaining programming codes unknowingly continued to thwart Ultron's plans of gaining access to nuclear missiles. His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.

His remains were found by Stark, who uploaded them into a synthetic body made of vibranium and, in conjunction with Ultron's personality and an Infinity Stone, an entirely new being was made: Vision. J.A.R.V.I.S.' duties were then taken over by F.R.I.D.A.Y.
